It also mandates State educational agencies to assist districts and schools in preventing and responding to such incidents. Additionally, the amendment includes performance indicators for bullying and harassment prevention programs and activities, along with annual notice to parents and students describing prohibited conduct. The amendment to the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act mandates reporting requirements on bullying and harassment incidents, along with procedures for registering complaints. It designates school officials responsible for receiving complaints and outlines timelines for resolving them. The amendment to the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act includes teaching students about the consequences of bullying and harassment, implementing programs addressing the causes of bullying, training teachers and administrators on prevention strategies, and reporting requirements on bullying and harassment incidents. The amendment to the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act includes adding bullying and harassment to the definition of school violence, drug and violence prevention programs, and defining bullying and harassment as risk factors. The Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act amendment now includes defining bullying as a risk factor, adding it to the definition of school violence, and specifying that bullying interferes with educational opportunities. The term 'harassment' in the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act refers to conduct directed at students based on various identities, interfering with educational opportunities and causing fear of physical harm. The Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act defines harassment as conduct that adversely affects a student's ability to participate in educational programs due to severity, pervasiveness, and offensiveness, including bullying and violence. SEC. 4156. EFFECT ON OTHER LAWS. The text states that federal and state nondiscrimination laws, as well as free speech and expression laws, will not be affected by the Safe and Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act.
